Actual behavior The "Check your email" screen is not centered — it's slightly off-center to the left. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) on the login screen Enter an email address linked to a WordPress.com account and tap Next Tap "Send link" (to send the magic link) Result: You end up on a "Check your email" screen where the text and button are off-center. Screenshots Correctly centered: Off-center: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28

buginformation.summary: PostUploadService refreshes the newly creeated post without taking in consideration the blogID
buginformation.description: PostUploadService calls the method WordPress.postUploaded by only passing the postID. WordPress.postUploaded internally calls the method OnPostUploaded of the current OnPostUploadedListener. Later in PostsListFragment->OnPostUploaded we use the postID and call getCurrentBlog to retrieve the post from the server and update the posts list. If the user switches blog while uploading, he/she will receive an error on the post list.

buginformation.summary: Deferred initialization causes problem with Mixpanel
buginformation.description: Loading account details is deferred, and may happen after we start tracking events. Deferred initialization introduced here b3bc0a0 What's happen in details: The commit above does move the loading of the user account on a separate thread. Meanwhile, before the initialization happens, the Analytics libraries could have already tracked some events when the app is in a state where the main .com account is still blank. Libraries tracks the user as a new anon user that is later (few events later in Tracks) aliased with the correct .com user On Tracks we should not have problems (*need to double check this with the team), but in Mixpanel we have problems since the user is tracked as 2 distinct users. Below is a picture that shows the UNIQUEs in Mixpanel for my account. (already logged in WP). A Tracks stack trace that shows what's happening: stdClass Object

buginformation.summary: Some users are losing posts when attempting upload
buginformation.description: I've had support threads with two users so far that can't upload posts in 2.6. They can uninstall the app and it will work for a while, but then posts won't upload and error with the blog_not_found error, which I believe happens here: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/util/PostUploadService.java#L207 One user gave me an author account on the site and I can't reproduce so far. Both users are attempting to upload images, so I'm wondering if #730 might have helped with this. I'm going to send the 2.6.1 beta to them to see if it fixes the issue.

buginformation.description: Edit a page Add an image. Tap the image and check the option to use it as a featured image. Do not check the option to include the image in the content. Publish the page. An image tag for the featured image is included in the post body even though you did not check the option to do this. The image tag is missing a src attribute, and has android-uri="content:// ... " instead.

buginformation.summary: Deleting post : confirmation appeared but post was still visible.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This was a little weird. I tried deleting a post by clicking the trashcan icon. I confirmed I wanted to delete the post. I saw the toast that the post was deleted. However the post was still visible on the screen until the post list refreshed. I think the right UX would be to show the toast after the post was removed.

buginformation.summary: Categories in quotes causes a f/c
buginformation.description: If you have a category with quotes like "Cars" it will force close when refreshing the categories.

buginformation.summary: Add wpcom Authorization Header to XML-RPC requests
buginformation.description: Add the wpcom Authorization Header to XML-RPC requests (when needed), and get rid of password. I had already implemented this here bdb50be but it did not make the cut for 2.6.1 (We can reuse that code though). Keep the following things in consideration: username/password are still used in a lot of place. Ex: AuthenticatedWebViewActivity, ReaderAuthActions (search for WordPress.WPCOM_PASSWORD_PREFERENCE). We should switch those calls to the OAuth Header. The backend first check the Authentication Header, if available it will use it for authentication purpose, completely ignoring the username/password available within the XML-RPC request document. ^ I think we can even skip the storage of password in the app when the bullets above are completed. Related: #851

buginformation.summary: Posts shown for wrong blog
buginformation.description: After adding Danilo's 3.6 self-hosted test site to the app, I waited a few seconds for the app to retrieve that blog's posts but it was taking too long so I switched to one of my blogs from the drawer. The posts from the 3.6 site suddenly appeared - but they were showing under the wrong blog (since I switched blogs). I switched back to the 3.6 site and after waiting a while a dialog appeared stating "Sorry, posts could not be refreshed at this time." I switched back to my blog again, and it was still showing the posts from the 3.6 site. Restarting the app didn't resolve the problem - my blog continued to show the wrong posts until I deleted it from the app. I believe the problem lies in PostListFragment's getRecentPostsTask. It uses WordPress.currentBlog.getId() when saving retrieved posts, but the current blog id may have changed since the task was started so the posts get saved under the wrong blog.

buginformation.summary: Can't connect to site that uses HTTPS redirect
buginformation.description: A user reported an issue with logging in to a site (http://www.androidpolice.com). The RSD response returned an HTTPS URL but the site would redirect all HTTPS request to HTTP. This confused the app and returned and ugly XML parser error in the app: This was fixable by instructing the user to enter the full path to xmlrpc.php, but the app can probably be smarter about catching this issue and then trying the URL again without using HTTPS.

buginformation.summary: Differentiate Helpshift login tag among wpcom/wporg/jetpack modes
buginformation.description: Currently, the login screen tags the Helpshift launch via the ? button on the login screen with the origin:login-screen-help tag. Let's differentiate the tag based on the login "mode" displayed at the time the user taps the ? button. Let's also remove the -help term as it's redundant. So, let's use origin:wpcom-login-screen for when in wpcom or magiclink mode, origin:wporg-login-screen when in selfhosted mode and origin:jetpack-login-screen when asking the user to login with wpcom to see the stats on a jetpack site.

Perhaps use setError instead? http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/TextView.html#setError(java.lang.CharSequence)

buginformation.summary: Launch "View Site" and "View Admin" in device browser instead of in-app browser
buginformation.description: Currently, the app's "View Admin" and "View Site" links open in an in-app browser. The problem: This leads to confusion when users try to use features that don't work well or at all in the in-app browser. Some things (like uploading media) are broken and/or don't work as well as features we have already implemented in the app itself. Possible solution: By changing "View Site" and "View Admin" to launch in the device browser, we can cut down on that confusion (and other effects like negative app reviews). We could also add contextual cues in the app to items that launch outside the app, similar to the icon Calypso uses to identify external links: Potential downsides: If the user isn't already logged in to the site in their browser, the visit to their site will be counted in their stats Users may be frustrated/confused about where they landed, having to log in again, getting back to the app.

Tap to view the draft post. The image is not there, neither is there any HTML for it. Try again, but this time take a photo instead of choosing an image from your gallery. buginformation.summary: WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying the wrong blog ID.
buginformation.description: While researching #181, I discovered that WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying by 'blogID' which is incorrect, it should be querying by the internal 'id'. If you add two self-hosted blogs with the same 'blogID' (it is usually '1') it will pull in posts for the wrong blog and cause problems very quickly.

buginformation.summary: Stop progress bar when the user changes blog
buginformation.description: Steps to repro: Go to posts and do a PTR Quickly open the drawer and change to another blog The progress bar is still going and you cannot do a PTR in the view. Even worst: if something bad happened during the PTR underlying network calls (say credentials errors) the loading bar is always running, you need to switch to comment to dismiss it. Also check pages and comments screens. Important: PTR on posts calls ApiHelper.RefreshBlogContentTask by passing the current blog as one parameter. RefreshBlogContentTask internally calls ApiHelper.refreshComments(mContext, commentParams); without passing the blog object (It relies on WordPress.getCurrentBlog()). So if you switch blog, the call to refreshComments will be done to the wrong URL (the url of the 2nd blog) with the credentials of the first blog.

buginformation.summary: Clean the "uploading" state for failed post uploads or app crash

The page is uploaded, with changes you may eventually done in post editor, but the new picture is missing, and just an empty IMG tag is in place.

buginformation.summary: Achievement icon too big in notification
Use setError instead of modal when user enter wrong credentials in sign in screen
buginformation.description: setError on both username and password fields

buginformation.summary: Media: Simple image editing would be useful
buginformation.description: When adding an image to a post either by capturing from within the WP editor or when browsing from the photo library, you can't crop or change the orientation. A real life scenario: I snapped a couple of photos of things my daughter had hand-written. They're in the photo library now. I upload to a post. Oops, they're sideways. I try to rotate within the WP app with no luck. I go into the photo library and rotate and crop. Now I have a duplicate image. What's worse, if I left the post mid-composition to edit the photos, my changes to the post are lost unless I remembered to save a draft first. Now I reinsert into the post and publish. If there's an API for doing even just basic rotating and cropping from within the app (say from the screen you get when you double-click an image within the editor), it'd make for a much improved workflow and reduce the likelihood of data loss.

buginformation.summary: Replace Log.x with AppLog.x application-wide

First extend the log to accept an identifier that tells which part of the app each log entry came from (Reader, posting, API, etc.), then start replacing calls to Log.x with AppLog.x application-wide.

buginformation.summary: The posts/pages list is not updated when you delete the last page/post of your blog
buginformation.description: Tried to deleted all the pages from my blog but the list is not correctly refreshed when the last page is removed from the blog. Pages list still has an entry for that page (that was correctly removed from the blog). Restarting the app fixes the issue. Tried to quickly fix it but found 2 strange behaviors in PostsListFragment: getRecentPostsTask returns success = false when the posts/pages list returned from the server is empty. It should return true, since the network connection is correctly completed. When false is returned the UI is not updated. If you delete all the pages from the app db, and return true (as it should be) in getRecentPostsTask, the method loadPosts is called. The latter calls refreshPosts, and goes in a loop...

buginformation.summary: ExceptionInitializerError

buginformation.summary: Remove periods from short strings
buginformation.description: We should follow this punctuation recommendation from Android Writing Style: Don't use a period after a single sentence or phrase used in isolation, such as in a toast, label, or notification. Wherever two or more sentences run together, use a period for each sentence. Note that this will require checking the context for each string ending in a period, to be sure it's not concatenated with another string for display.

buginformation.summary: Apostrophe displayed incorrectly when replying from a notification
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When replying to a comment notification, if you leave the same comment twice, a message pops up that should say "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you've already said that!" Actual behavior The message doesn't render the apostrophe correctly, and actually reads as "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you#8217;ve already said that! This only happens when replying from the notification. Replying from the Reader displays a more basic "Couldn't post your comment" popup. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and tap the notifications icon Scroll down to a comment notification, and open it Use the 'Reply to [Commenter Name] field to submit a comment Once the comment is submitted, try saying the same thing again to trigger the popup Tested on HTC One M9, Android 6.0

buginformation.summary: Blog options not requested until returning to app

This was because I had just added the blog to the app, and RefreshBlogContentTask hadn't been run for it yet. Looks like it is only run when you switch blogs, or return to the app. We could either run RefreshBlogContentTask after adding a blog to the app, or just get the options as an additional step in the Account setup process?

buginformation.summary: Replace local event broadcasting by EventBus

SuggestionService + receivers XMLRPCClient + receivers StatisticsService + receivers MediaUploadService + receivers NotificationsUtils + receivers BlogList Update + receivers Ref. #2332

buginformation.summary: Storing account details for the user
buginformation.description: We need an Account model where we keep information about the user such as their username, email, gravatar url, if it's a WordPress.com user or not etc. Ideally there should be a way to get the default WordPress.com account user so we can use that information in the new "Me" page. This will also be good for us developers for information management on account login/logout and when the user updates his/her information.

buginformation.summary: Blog.save() called ~100 times when switching from Stats to Post list
buginformation.description: When I switch from "Stats" to "Post" and back, I noticing some slow down on my Nexus 5 After some profiling, I noticed Blog.save() was called ~2 times / sec for for a total of ~100 times (the tested account owns only 3 blogs), blogs haven't been changed so we should not call save(). Also we should check queued RefreshBlogContentTask tasks and remove duplicate calls.

buginformation.summary: Try to use one network call only when saving changes in Notifications settings screen
buginformation.description: The app starts a network connection as soon as you change a setting in the notifications settings screen, resulting in multiple network connections where the order of execution is not preserved, and could cause wrong settings to be saved on the server. As an example, I was changing 2 settings, but the 2nd network call finished/arrived on the server before the first. The 1st connection overwrote settings just few seconds later.

buginformation.summary: Pictures are uploaded in a service that internally uses AsyncTask
buginformation.description: Was trying to upload a picture to the blog from the media library. Found out that if you tap on the picture to show the details when it is in "uploading" state, the MediaItemFragment doesn't show a preview of the picture (even if it's a local picture stored on the phone). This is because the ImageView that holds the pictures in MediaItemFragment is populated by an AsyncTask in background (correct, since bitmap decoding could take time), but at the same time another AsyncTask is uploading the picture in MediaUploadService, and there are no available threads to complete the rendering operation. When the uploading is completed the Rendering is finally done, since a thread is now available to run the task. AsyncThreads should be used for short operations only. Don't know if there is a simple way to increase the number of concurrent threads in AsyncTask. Same issue if you tap on another picture while the current picture is in "uploading". The preview of the 2nd picture is not shown on the screen even if it already uploaded on the blog, or available locally on the phone.

buginformation.summary: Refactor PostsListFragment
buginformation.description: PostsListFragment is doing a bunch of things incorrectly (I think it has remained largely unchanged since wpToGo in 2008...) Some ToDos: Remove the separate calls to load the local drafts and uploaded posts. A while back the local drafts were changed to be stored in the same table as uploaded posts, so we only need one query. Use a proper BaseAdapter/CursorAdapter for retrieving and displaying the posts data from the db. Proper m/v/c. Maybe use DateUtils.getRelativeTimeSpanString() for displaying the relative date to now? Add infinite scroll (see Notifications for an implementation of this) Make sure that these changes also fix #181.

buginformation.summary: Better post publish/save button
buginformation.description: I think we can improve the understandability of the post publish button by removing the 'paper airplane' icon and using text instead. @bummytime did this in his post draft saving project and I really liked how it looked. If the post status is 'publish' then the button will read 'PUBLISH', any other status will change it to 'SAVE'. I also thought it made sense to have this button be available in the post settings and preview fragments, so you can publish/save from wherever you are in the editor. I made a video to demo how it could work: https://cloudup.com/cnDXLXdnJ5Q Thoughts?

buginformation.summary: Kickstarter oEmbed URLs not embedding in posts published from the app
buginformation.description: Expected behavior I expected Kickstarter URLs starting with kickstarter.com/projects or kck.st to be embedded in a post, per the oEmbed list here: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/master/wp-includes/class-oembed.php#L94 This works as expected when publishing from the web and viewing the post on the web. Actual behavior Kickstarter URLs are displayed as plain links in the published post (in the app and on the web) instead of being embedded. Steps to reproduce the behavior Find a Kickstarter project and copy the link to it (both the full URL and the short kck.st version) In the app, start a new post Paste the links to the Kickstarter project on their own lines in the editor Publish the post Result: The projects are not embedded in the post. buginformation.summary: Load posts from wpDB method, clean up Post model
buginformation.description: I think one of the causes for #862 was that we are passing a localTableBlogId to the Posts model to load an existing post. There was no currentBlog, so the blogId was set to -1 and 'lost' in the database. We should simply pass a local post id to a method in wpDB that will retrieve the post. No need for the 'blogId' or 'isPage' parameters either. We could then remove the constructor in Posts.java that did database work.

buginformation.summary: Incorrect Usages of blog.getId() and blog.getBlogId()?
buginformation.description: I think some poor naming has caused some problems in the app. In the Blog model we have getId() and getBlogId(). The 'id' is the local id of the blog, corresponds to the unique key in the local SQLite blog table. The 'blogId' is the remote blog ID, which is typically just '1' for WordPress.org blogs, and on Multi-site and WordPress.com it is a unique integer that identifies the individual blog across the site instance. The problem I'm seeing is that we are often using getBlogId() as the key for other objects, such as in Media. If a user has multiple self-hosted blogs with a blogId of '1' then they are going to see media items for both blogs when they visit media. I think we need to rename these to be clearer, and do an audit of the app and fix instances where we should use the id instead of the blogId.

buginformation.summary: Stats: Pictures are shown as entry in "Posts and Pages" module but cannot be opened in Reader
buginformation.description: Pictures are shown as top-level entry in "Posts and Pages" module, but cannot be opened in the Reader when tapping on them. The Reader api returns a 404 error since they are not posts/pages. This should be probably fixed in the backend. A new field that identifies the kind of the item should do the trick. Once we see a picture, we will call the in-app web browser instead of Reader.

buginformation.summary: People: Confusing styling on the Role selection dropdown
buginformation.description: The Role selector on the Invite page looks like it's hardcoded to the preset value of Follower/Viewer. I'd also like to see a help link to http://en.support.wordpress.com/user-roles/ with the descriptions of what the different roles mean, like the one that exists on the web version of the invite page. ##### Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

buginformation.summary: Media: Editing media in the app deletes it from the server on WP 3.4.2
buginformation.description: Go to the media list. Tap the add button and capture a photo. Once its uploaded, sign into the webadmin and confirm the image exists. In the detail screen, edit the caption and description. Click save, then refresh. The item you just captured vanishes from the list. Refresh the web admin and its gone from there as well. Seeing this on a blog hosted on appfog running 3.4.2, but can not reproduce on 3.6. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Media: 404 images show as empty space in the list and detail.
buginformation.description: To reproduce. On a self hosted blog, add some media attachments to your blog. Login to the server and manually move / delete the image files. Go to the app and view the media feature. The media items with the missing images will show a placeholder in the list but if you tap the list it will disappear. The detail always shows empty space where the image should be. A 404 image might be nice. Maybe a bit of an edgecase but I'm thinking of blogs with missing media due to bad migrations or broken gallery plugins. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.summary: Tag-like strings need to be filtered when creating a new category.

The category is actually bar. It might be easiest if the app fetched the canonical category from the site vs trying to filter edge cases like this client side.

buginformation.summary: When a post is uploading it's still tagged "Local draft" in the post list
buginformation.description: It's confusing, maybe change it temporarily to Uploading, if the upload fails change it back to Local draft. This is especially confusing when uploading a big post (say 10 pictures), start to write a new one, come back to the list, both post have the same status.

buginformation.summary: Stats: duplicated "Week 12"

buginformation.summary: FluxC integration: Site picker sometimes doesn't work
buginformation.description: I'm sometimes unable to switch sites using the site picker in the fluxc-integration branch. There is no error, but I'm returned to the site fragment with the same site active as before. The only way to change sites is to remove the current site (or sign out of WP.com). I've so far only been able to reproduce this on an emulator (API 23). This will happen every time I use the site picker until the app is reinstalled (and most recently, the issue persists even after multiple clean installs). After some testing, I'm seeing that getSiteFragment() is returning null here, so the result of the SitePickerActivity seems to be discarded, and that's the reason the site doesn't changed.

buginformation.summary: Tapping a tab icon calls onTabReselected and makes the view scrolls to top
buginformation.description: Demo: https://cloudup.com/cXvvwrLe6KK Probably a bug in the support library v22: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=177189 - looks like it's fixed in v23.

buginformation.summary: Media: Deleting an item does not update the counters.
buginformation.description: Go to the media feature. Notice the number of items currently in the list. Tap an item to view its detail. Tap to view the action bar menu and choose the delete option. You're back on the main list, the item is removed, but the count did not update. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

buginformation.summary: Post upload needs a progress bar
buginformation.description: The status notification that a post is being uploaded should have a progress bar, at least when uploading an image or (especially) a video.

buginformation.summary: Add option to remember last share selection
buginformation.description: User request: Add a checkbox to the share dialog that will remember the selected blog and option (new post or media library):

buginformation.summary: Adding media to post should be done on background thread
buginformation.description: From #2317 For every media item selected by the user a WPImageSpan is added to the post. This work is done serially and on the main thread, if there are too many items selected the editor will hang until all the spans are generated. The bitmaps for the WPImageSpans should be generated on a background thread to reduce user impact. See video

The notifications list has duplicated its items. You may need to scroll down to see the dups. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7

buginformation.description: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Content view not yet created

buginformation.summary: People: User role from Team shows up next to non-user viewer
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When a user is going through the Team, Followers, Email Followers, and Viewers, the correct user role (or lack of) should show up next to the username. Actual behavior Going from Team > Followers > Viewers in rapid succession results in the user role of someone in Team showing up as the user role next to the Viewer's username. ### Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Site dashboard > People. Add viewer to site. Start with Team selected, then select Followers (or Email Followers), then Viewers. Result: A user role of a user in Team will show up as the user role of the viewer, despite the viewer not having a user role. You must go from Team > Followers or Email Followers > Viewers to replicate the issue, going from Team > Viewers will result in seeing no user role next to the viewer, which is correct. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Plus, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-20

buginformation.summary: Crash report 3.9.1: AssertionError in StatsCommentsFragment
buginformation.description: I've checked all reports, it an Android 4.2.2 bug only. Probably a platform bug. I tried to repro on a 4.2.2 emulator with en-gb or en-au selected but it didn't crashed. Also it's weird because the crash occurs on a Fragment.getString(STR, number) call only in StatsCommentsFragment, when it's also used other stats fragment (StatsFollowersFragment for example). It's rare (8 users affected), but I suspect it's super annoying (crash loop on app start). java.lang.AssertionError: couldn't initialize LocaleData for locale en-gb

buginformation.summary: A category containing a comma shows up as two categories on the edit screen.
buginformation.description: If I have the category "marco,polo", it shows up as a single category on the category list, but as two categories: "marco" and "polo" on the post editor. Fun fact: You can create categories that include a comma :)

buginformation.summary: Swiping away a push notification should remove it from future notifications
buginformation.description: If you swipe to dismiss a notification, and then receive another notification, you'll see that it has grouped the two notifications together even though you've dismissed the first one. Question: Should dismissing a notification also mark that note as read, if possible?

buginformation.summary: Media browser blank images
buginformation.description: Quite often while using the media browser, images that I know have already been downloaded (cached) show up blank. This happens in multiple situations, but I can repro it consistently by opening the media browser, tapping an image to view the detail, then returning to the media browser. Demo video

buginformation.summary: Media Library: Image disappears from view shortly after upload - 4.6-rc-3
buginformation.description: When uploading a picture to the media library I see it show up in the view momentarily, and then it disappears. After leaving and going back in it shows up just fine. Here's a screencap recorded off of my emulator (on a self-compiled apk using the latest source from git) connected to a self-hosted site, although I saw the same problem on the latest beta on my OnePlus One connected to WordPress.com. https://cloudup.com/iyGvmEjotjP The difference is that the logfile on the emulator has an exception relating to the media library that isn't present on the real device. Although you'll see in the video that re-opening the Media Library was unresponsive for a moment, so the exception may be related to that. The full logfile can be found here: http://wp-srstancil.rhcloud.com/2015/10/09/wordpress-application-log/

buginformation.summary: Trashing Post From App Permenantly Deletes It
buginformation.description: Tested in both current production version and current beta version. When you trash a post from the app it is permanently deleted. It would make more sense if it were sent to the Trash instead so that you have the ability to restore before it is gone for good.

buginformation.summary: Auto-dismiss notifications
buginformation.description: If a push notification is showing on the device, and the user ignores it and navigates to notifications in the app instead, we should dismiss the push notification.

buginformation.summary: App can have wrong blog active after hiding blogs
buginformation.description: Add an account with multiple blogs. Take note of which blog is currently active. Hide all blogs except for a blog that is different than the currently active one. Return from settings, and you will be stuck using the first active blog.

buginformation.summary: Rotating comment view on tablet switches blogs
buginformation.description: Get out a large tablet like the nexus 10 that has multiple blogs Select 'Comments' form the navigation drawer Rotate the device Observe that the blog switches and the comments list is refreshed.

buginformation.summary: Sign In: Leaving the self-hosted login screen, it reverts back to WordPress.com login
buginformation.description: When first opening the app, if you go to the self-hosted login screen, leave the screen (either within the app or by exiting and reopening the app), and the return to the login screen, it will revert back to the WordPress.com login screen. Steps to reproduce: Open the app while logged out Select "Add self-hosted site" Optional: begin to enter your account information Tap on the Help icon (?) in the top right, or exit the app on your device Go back to the login screen Result: You see the WordPress.com login screen instead of the self-hosted login screen you were just on I encountered this in a very normal login flow, where I entered my username and site URL but had to leave the app to get my password. When I reopened the app, I saw the wrong login screen. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

buginformation.summary: Account Settings: Primary site selection persists when you select a different site
buginformation.description: Expected behavior I expect to open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and have the old primary site selection cleared. Actual behavior I open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and two sites (the old primary site and the new one) are now selected in the list. (However, selecting OK makes the correct change.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to the Me tab Select Account Settings Select Primary site Note that your current primary site is selected, and select a different site. Result: Both sites are now selected in the list of sites. If you tap on your current primary site first, and then select a different site, the radio buttons work as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-6

buginformation.summary: Unusable slider for image size in the editor
buginformation.description: as mentionned here ​http://androiddevel.wordpress.com/2012/01/23/heres-whats-on-the-list-for-2-0-5/#comment-7908 As the default image size currently doesn't work (it always uploads pictures à 500px), we have to change the size of the uploaded media in the text editor, by taping on the picture. There's a slider for that purpose. The slider is not really precise if you're not a kid with tiny fingers. A spinner or even a text field would be really better. Even if i have a big screen (4.3"), it takes at least 30 seconds before i can make my picture 960px wide (it always fall on 940px, or 970px when i remove my finger), whereas it would take like 2 seconds with a spinner or a text field.

buginformation.summary: Editor: When there is no media, don't show a blank Select From Media Library view.
buginformation.description: From the editor, if a user tries to add a photo, and chooses the "Select from Media Library" option from the dialog, if the user has not uploaded any media to their blog this page is blank. Let's inform the user that there is no media, or prompt them to choose from another source. Even better, can we not show this option in the initial dialog.

buginformation.summary: Hidden blog sometimes becomes visible again.
buginformation.description: Doesn't happen every time. Race condition maybe? From a fresh install, sign in with a WP.com account with multiple blogs. Go to Settings Tap Show / Hide blogs Hide the first blog (which was my default blog) Refresh. Tap back. Notice that the blog you just hid is not in the list. Tap back to dismiss settings. Notice a different blog is now showing its post list. Confirm in the side bar that the blog is not visible. Go back to settings. The blog you removed is back in the list. Tap show / hide blogs. The previously removed blog is checked. Nexus 4. KitKat.

buginformation.summary: Improve WP.com Two-Factor Authentication
buginformation.description: Make two-factor authentication easier: Remove the requirement for an app-specific password, instead allow entry of the time-based code from an auth app or sms. Maybe integrate with the auth apps to see if we can get the code instantly (not sure if authy/google have available intents for something like that) Implement #911 so that xml-rpc requests will still work.

buginformation.summary: WordPress.com login prompt shows after returning to StatsActivity with no Jetpack connection
buginformation.description: Add a self-hosted site that doesn't have Jetpack. Visit stats, then quickly leave the app. When you return to the stats view, you get the WordPress.com login prompt, as well as the Jetpack installation message.

buginformation.summary: Cleanup unused resources
buginformation.description: ~150 unused resources at the moment: $ lint --check UnusedResources . | grep "res/" | grep -v "values-.*strings"

buginformation.summary: Reader: Reblog option shown for self-hosted site
buginformation.description: In the Reader I was given the option to Reblog a post to a self-hosted site. I wasn't signed in the the WordPress.com account that this self-hosted site is using Jetpack with. Upon tapping the Reblog button, a toast message showed telling me it failed to Reblog.

buginformation.summary: Better UI for two-step users
buginformation.description: Two-step auth users on WP.com can quickly get confused when trying to sign into the app. We should add clear instructions in the app to help them create an application-specific password. I've added a better description of the error in ​146107f4f05d7dae759381ecfe8ca6c5e0a0ed84. Unfortunately the support page ​http://en.support.wordpress.com/security/two-step-authentication/#application-specific-passwords doesn't work fine on mobile browser, and redirect users there doesn't seem to be an option. I've then tried to redirect the user to the settings page ​https://wordpress.com/?ssl=forced#!/settings/security/, but even this one is not "mobile friendly".

buginformation.summary: Reader Detail Page can be Blank
buginformation.description: If you are on a reader detail page, then press home and leave the app for a while, when you return to the app it will load a blank detail view.

buginformation.summary: WPImageGetter should "Photon-ize" the image URL before downloading
buginformation.description: WPImageGetter accepts a "maxSize" parameter that forces images to be resized, but the full image is still being downloaded. Use Photon where possible to retrieve the image and the desired size.

buginformation.summary: Back button doesn't quit the app
buginformation.description: Reproduced on 4.0 and 4.1. On a "root" activity (Reader or Notifications for instance) tap the back button, the current activity restarts. Expected behavior: the app is put in background and the home screen is shown. Problem comes from our WPLaunchActivity which is still in the activity backstack, so when a "root" activity finishes, WPLaunchActivity is created and re-launch the current "root" activity.

buginformation.summary: Nav Drawer Layout Issues
buginformation.description: These appear to be isolated to Android 4.X, I don't see it on Lollipop: Blog spinner doesn't have proper right padding. (Note, I had a similar issue in Simplenote and I fixed it by changing the drawer layout's width to match_parent) Drawer shadow gets cut off at the bottom.

buginformation.summary: Exchange Vectors with ArrayLists
buginformation.description: I found some Vectors used in the code, where ArrayLists should be enough (iterating inside of a method in example). Vectors are synchronized and therefor coming with some overhead compared to ArrayLists. So use ArrayLists, where no concurrent access to the List is needed (what is in most cases the case). An example: ViewPosts.getRecentPostsTask.onPostExecute(). Vectors are created and used there only. Why do you need it to be synchronized?

buginformation.summary: ReaderDatabase crash in onDowngrade()
buginformation.description: ReaderDatabase.onDowngrade() crashes right now because it calls super(), which immediately throws a SQLiteException. Simple fix is to not call super().

buginformation.summary: unable to remove spam from comments listing
buginformation.description: using Wordpress for Android v2.8 on a Galaxy S4. Self-hosted Wordpress In my listing of comments on my site, there are some 20 spam comments, listed as "Pending". However, trying to remove them fails, and I will explain why. I had them listed in the app, but then went to the blog with my browser and removed them in Wordpress instead. Ever since, I cannot remove them from the app. When I try to either mark them spam or trash them, I get "an error occurred while moderating" and the comment is not removed from the listing. The log shows that there is an error 404 on the request.

buginformation.summary: Uploading arbitrary files
buginformation.description: Wordpress allows uploading arbitrary files if correctly configured. If the android app allowed that too, one could upload gpx tracks and have them visualized by the gp2graphics plugin for wordpress! Add another item in the media choose dialog that lets users choose a file with a file manager (if installed).

buginformation.summary: Trapped on the configure blog screen.
buginformation.description: When adding a self hosted blog on a spotty wifi connection you can get trapped on the "Attempting to configure blog" screen for a long period of time. It might make sense to make this dismissable and let the user reattempt to add the blog with a better connection, or another time, than be stuck waiting for the call to timeout/finish.

buginformation.summary: Don't publish blank posts.
buginformation.description: Create a new post. Don't add any content or make any other changes. Tap the publish button. The app uploads the blank post, but then the upload fails with a notification that a title, content, or excerpt was missing. We should just check for the required content before uploading.

buginformation.summary: Login screen: in airplane mode, show a "No connection" error
buginformation.description: Current error message when a user tries to login: generic message: "We can't log you in" We must change it to: "No network available" and only display the "cancel" button.

buginformation.summary: My Profile: Rotating device loses unsaved changes
buginformation.description: While editing the fields in the My Profile section in /me, I rotated my device. This closed the window where I was making the changes without saving anything, so my changes were lost. That wouldn't be so terrible for the first/last name or display name, but I had added a big chunk of text to the "About Me" section and it was frustrating to lose it and have to start over. Ideally, I should be able to rotate the device and have the field I was editing stay open so I can continue editing it until I save or cancel the changes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, beta 5.0-rc-1

buginformation.summary: Local drafts linker after publishing and the post list does not refresh.
buginformation.description: Steps to reproduce: Create a new post. Make some edits and tap the back button. Choose Save when prompted to save the post as a local draft. Edit the post. Tap the publish button. The post will publish but will remain as a local draft, and the post list does not automatically refresh. Tap refresh. You are prompted that you are about to overwrite local changes. Choose OK. After refreshing the local draft is gone.

buginformation.summary: Post Editor: Strange looking content area on gingerbread
buginformation.description: https://cloudup.com/cMSn0NBK4h9

buginformation.summary: Posts: Change title of post and update the ViewPostFragment of the opened Post
buginformation.description: When you edit the title of the post and Publish/Save the post, it will load the ViewPostFragment with older details. The ViewPostFragment will only update when you open the post again from the listview

buginformation.summary: Don't show the lock screen for login page
buginformation.description: Don't ask passcode lock if am in login page.

buginformation.summary: Crash report 2.7.1 - NPE in ReaderPostDetailFragment bis
buginformation.description: java.lang.NullPointerException

buginformation.summary: Post Editor: Formatting blocks can be applied around images
buginformation.description: Create a new post Add some text in bold, leave the cursor at the end of the text. Add an image, then save the post as a local draft. Edit the post again, the image will be lost because the bold span wrapped around the entire image.

buginformation.summary: Cancelling post signature does not dismiss the keyboard.
buginformation.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Go to settings. Tap the Post Signature option to edit the text. Tap the cancel button. The modal dismisses but the keyboard remains.

buginformation.summary: Image caption appears in the editor after rotating.
buginformation.description: These are the steps I took, some may not be necessary: Create a new post In the editor add an image, then add another image. Tap the first image and make it featured and include in content, and give it a caption. Tap the second image and give it a caption. Rotate the device. The caption of the second image is now included in the post content.

buginformation.summary: Add url subtitles on Show/hide blogs settings
buginformation.description: From an user: I have three blogs named “XXX”. I only wanted two to be visible, but it wasn’t immediately clear which one was which. I had to exit the hide screen, and look at the post screen for each blog. If we provided the URL / subdomain it would clear up which was which.

buginformation.summary: Selecting images from self-hosted site does not add them to the editor
buginformation.description: I think this is the culprit. This is an issue with both selecting media and gallery creation.

buginformation.summary: Broken test: BlogTest::testGetSetPrivate()
buginformation.description: The BlogTest::testGetSetPrivate() test is broken as it doesn't take into account the condition of whether the blog is a WPCom one or not (only WPCom blogs can be marked private).

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Open reader post from comment list
buginformation.description: You should be able to tap the post title to open the reader post when viewing from a comment notification. This used to work, probably a regression in 4.5 or 4.6.

buginformation.summary: Refresh the posts/pages list on activity creation
buginformation.description: Some users complained their posts list on the app is not in sync with their web posts list.

buginformation.summary: Notifications: Comment reply notification shows CDATA from XML
buginformation.description: Comment reply about a reblog shows some CDATA from the XML. Maybe specific to reblogs?

buginformation.summary: Checked comments are kept after selecting and deleting comments
buginformation.description: Go to the Comments view Select 1 or more comments (via checkboxes) Delete them Comments are deleted but checkboxes are still checked develop branch

buginformation.summary: Increase text leading in Post Editor for better readability
buginformation.description: Reported by a user comparing Google Keep and WPAndroid editors:

buginformation.summary: Switching tabs on stats should animate and be swipable
buginformation.description: When you switch from 'TODAY' to 'YESTERDAY' in the stats view, it loads the new data with a jerky view switch. We should make it a nice animation that you can also swipe left/right to move between.

buginformation.summary: Sidebar doesn't show newly added .com blog as an option.
buginformation.description: Start with one blog in the app. I was logged in with a wp.com account with four blogs, three of which were hidden. Go to settings. Tap to create a new wp.com blog. You're returned to the settings screen when you're done and you see the newly added blog in the list. Dismiss the settings screen. Check the sidebar. Notice the blog picker is absent and you can't switch to your newly added blog. Nexus 4 / KitKat

buginformation.summary: Post/Page list loses its place after refreshing.
buginformation.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the post list Pick an item midway down the list. Refresh the post list and wait for it to finish. The first item is now selected. Page list has the same behavior

buginformation.summary: "Cannot serialize null" uploading modified post
buginformation.description: I'm able to duplicate the "cannot serialize null" error several testers have reported. The exception occurs in XMLRPCClient.java when the passed "params" are serialized. As the screenshot below illustrates, the "params" object starts at index 1 which causes a null exception when params[0] is serialized. (Repro'd on Genymotion S2 emulator, Android v2.3.7) If I close the app after the exception occurs then return to the post list, the post is gone.

buginformation.summary: Media stays empty after selecting invalid custom date
buginformation.description: Select "Custom Date" on the Media filter Choose two dates in the future so that no media appear Return to "Custom Date" and choose a date range that should show media No media appear, even though the date range is now valid

buginformation.summary: Let user know about no connection in PTR
buginformation.description: If the user performs a pull-to-refresh when there's no connection, the PTR message should let the user know there's no connection and not bother performing the refresh. Similar iOS ticket here

buginformation.summary: Comments: Row highlight issue on Gingerbread
buginformation.description: On a gingerbread device, tap on a comment row and you'll see the whole list flash with a blue highlight. The selection still works though which is good.

buginformation.summary: Rename "Blogs visibility" title to "Blogs"
buginformation.description: The addition of the refresh button (in overflow menu) is cutting off the current title

buginformation.summary: IllegalStateException when selecting media items
buginformation.description: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can not perform this action after onSaveInstanceState

buginformation.summary: NPE: missing strings
buginformation.description: I'm getting a NPE when trying to delete a page/post. R.string.delete_page R.string.delete_post are missing from the strings.xml

buginformation.summary: Restore isActivityDestroyed() method in WPActionBarActivity
buginformation.description: 487d182 accidentally removed the isActivityDestroyed() method, which is an API 17 check.

buginformation.summary: Notification stacking issue on 4.5.1
buginformation.description: Sometimes (?) notifications staking doesn't work, and user gets a growing list of notifications. I can't repro, but @daniloercoli was affected by the bug too. From a Play Store comment: Notifications issue. With the latest update the notifications are not aggregated anymore. In a few minutes I had my status bar filled with a ton of notifications; annoying. I wonder if that could come from this patch f8d5108

buginformation.summary: Short comment notifications don't display properly in detail view
buginformation.description: If a comment is less than one line, it will be wrapped incorrectly in the notification comment detail view.

buginformation.summary: Reader: Play button is off-center
buginformation.description: On my galaxy s4, the play button is not centered in the detail view of the reader. https://cloudup.com/cfiKCm2ub58

buginformation.summary: Helpshift reintegration
buginformation.description: Reintegrate helpshift with the 3.5.0 library version and check the app restart issue is fixed.

buginformation.summary: Crash report 3.9-rc-1: RuntimeException in FetchBlogListAbstract
buginformation.description: Probably a side effect of the 2 step auth merge. java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError

buginformation.summary: Adding tracking for when a user replies to Helpshift
buginformation.description: WordPress-iOS Ref wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#3463 Helpshift now permits to listen to different events happening in their lib - SDK doc: https://www.helpshift.com/docs/api/android/v3.x/reference/com/helpshift/Helpshift.HelpshiftDelegate.html

buginformation.summary: Drop mshot and follower count from reader blog preview
buginformation.description: For consistency with the iOS app, drop the mshot and follower count, and show the blavatar.

buginformation.summary: HTTP Auth dialog is shown when we should show a specific error message.
buginformation.description: In feature/fluxc-integration, when the xmlrpc endpoints return a 403 ( on listMethods), we show a HTTP Auth dialog to the user when we should show a "Access to your XMLRPC endpoint is forbidden, you should check your http server config or contact your host". We should also redirect the user to the right FAQ page on that screen.

buginformation.summary: Images shared to a post from media library are too large
buginformation.description: Share a single image to a post from the media library. Observe that the image is too large and covers the majority of the editing area.

buginformation.summary: Crash report 3.9-rc-1: NPE in HtmlToSpannedConverter.startImg
buginformation.description: Probably a side effect introduced by the new media picker: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: Media: Broken images after canceling a post. Also Crash
buginformation.description: This is easiest to see if you create a new wp.com blog with no posts or media. Go to the post editor and create a new post. Add some media via the post editor. You should see the thumbnails in the editor. Tap the back button and discard the post. Switch to the Media option in the menu. Notice there is an item in the media list but the thumbnail is blank. Tap to view the detail and the photo there is also blank. Bonus: Try to delete the media item and the app crashes.

buginformation.summary: Notifications - DB/Cache is not cleated on logout
buginformation.description: I did the logout, and just after I logged in again with a different wpcom user. The app took me on the Notifications list screen, and all the old notifications were there till the initial refresh was completed.

buginformation.summary: Magic Link: Logging in with magic link results in "Incorrect username or password" errors
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When I log in to a WordPress.com account, I expect everything to work the same no matter how I log in (username & password, email & password, email & magic link). Actual behavior When I log in with a username & password or email & password, the app works as expected. When I log in with my email and a magic link, some parts of the app do not work. Instead, I get the error "Incorrect username or password." This happens when I tap on: Blog Posts > View an individual post Pages > View an individual page Themes > any action (e.g. Customize, Details, Support) In the logs, I see this corresponding error: Username empty/null Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) to the login screen Enter your WordPress.com account email address Tap "Send link" to get the magic link Open your email and tap the button to log in Logged in, go to Blog Posts and tap "View" under a post Result: You get the error "Incorrect username or password." You can repeat this after logging in with a password and note that it works as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28

buginformation.summary: Notifications don’t always open on Android when tapping on a Push Notification
buginformation.description: Expected behavior When tapping on a WordPress push notification in the device notification center, the full notification content should open inside the app. Actual behavior I tap on the notification and the WordPress app opens on the notifications tab showing the full list of all my read notifications, but the one that I tapped on is not in the list, as if it doesn’t actually exist. (The toast "Could not open the notification" can appear for few secs). If I then wait for a while (anything from a few seconds to a minute or two), the unread notification will appear at the top. Sometimes I have to kill the app completely and reopen it to get the notification to be displayed in the list. Steps to reproduce the behavior This seems to happen mostly when I’m on a slower internet connection (mobile data with poor reception or unreliable wifi), so what I’m guessing is happening is that the push notification is received, but the synch with Simperium fails, or it's not started at all. Btw, sometimes it happened also when I was on fast connections. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Android 6.01 Tested on Nexus 5x Android 7.0

buginformation.summary: Custom post types, custom taxonomies, and custom fields
buginformation.description: It would be extremely useful if Wordpress for Android supported custom post types, custom taxonomies, and custom fields. I would like to formally request that the functionality be added.

buginformation.summary: Sharing a link sometimes strips the anchor tag
buginformation.description: A user has reported that sharing a link from the browser to the app will sometimes strip the anchor tag, so the link isn't clickable.

buginformation.summary: Push notification icon looks empty on lollipop
buginformation.description: The icon that appears when you have more than one PN looks empty on Lollipop due to the lighter background.

buginformation.summary: Crash report 4.1 - IllegalStateException accessing comment Cursor
buginformation.description: Accessing an OOB row? Weird because moveToNext just returned true. java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: NUX: Wait indicator wonkiness when creating account on Gingerbread
buginformation.description: The same issue as #433, but on the create new account screen.

buginformation.summary: Fix our scripts in the `tools` directory
buginformation.description: In the https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/tree/feature/modularization branch we changed directory structure, so we need to edit scripts in tools/ to work with this new structure.

buginformation.summary: App acts weird if you're not an Editor or Admin on all of your blogs
buginformation.description: A user reported that the app is unresponsive and sometime lags or exposes unexpected behavior if hte user logged in isn't an Admin or Editor on all sites. also the login shows an odd behaviour: After entering my credentials at the login page the app shows a black screen for some moments then again requests the credentials, and again, and again, ... But if I cancel the login request I actually enter the app and my site/statistics/... Here's the log that shows some 403 and 401 errors: WordPress Android version: 4.6 Android device name: Samsung GT-I8160 01 - WordPress.onCreate

buginformation.summary: Crash report 2.7.1 - NPE in SyncMediaLibraryTask
buginformation.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground()

buginformation.summary: Auto save and restore EditText content
buginformation.description: For some EditText, we should automatically save the content and restore it when the user is back. Example usage: User starts typing a comment in the Reader then navigate back to the post content - if he taps the comment button again (on the same post), the app should retrieve previously typed comment and prefill the comment box. The ideal solution should work on any EditText widget.

buginformation.summary: Swipe To Refresh can be triggered when a view it already refreshing
buginformation.description: Demo video: https://cloudup.com/c9HlwF1OeX5 Happens on the Reader and Posts list. Probably on other STR screens too. I wonder if that comes from a change in our SwipeToRefreshHelper

buginformation.summary: Ugly reblog dropdown on Gingerbread
Notifications: Add replied noticon to list view
buginformation.description: The notifications list should show a replied icon if a user has replied to a comment notification: https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/618551/5865730/21bea10e-a251-11e4-9d93-48372fb2d2ad.png

buginformation.summary: Verify Infinite Scroll is Working Properly in Notifications
buginformation.description: Install the app fresh. Load notifications, make sure your account has more than 40 notifications. Scroll to the bottom, and observe that no more notifications are loaded.
